1.content: choose a person to fatten
1.title: choose your victim

choices: Shepard is force-fed alien substance making him gain weight
Shepard gets turned into a human balloon as he is inflated with air
Shepard get's turned into a fat blueberry
112.content:
In a poorly lit room, commander Shepard slowly regained consciousness. He tried to move but he soon realized he was strapped and restrained to a large operating table. In front of him was a large mirror. His mind was still hazy, and he couldn't recall how he ended up where he was. One moment he was with his squad fighting the blood pack, and now he was tied to a table like some twisted science experiment. Waking up in odd places wasn't all that new to him however, he had sneaking suspicion alcohol wasn't involved this time.

"I've got to get out of here!" Shepard whispered to himself as he tried to free from his restraints.

"It's no use Shepard, there is no point escaping," a deep mysterious voice called out from the shadows. As the footsteps drew closer Shepard could recognize the shape of a large Krogan and two Vorcha who were accompanying him.

Shepard glares at the menacing Krogan, it didn't take a genius to figure out he was their leader. "I take it you're in charge?"

The Krogan stepped forth and lights his cigar "That obvious huh? The names Wrang, And you've must be the ass-hole who has been killing my men"

The blood pack was known for being cruel and merciless with their pray. Shepard knew he had to choose his words carefully if he wanted to stay alive
"I did what I had to stay alive. I'm sure you would have done the same"

The krogan remained silent as he took a huff from his cigar "You know I've heard stories about you. People say you're a hero. But all I see is a fraud hiding behind his own inflated ego"

Shepard was growing impatient. Clearly, the blood pack had something up their sleeve otherwise he wouldn't be breathing "If you wanted to kill me you would have already done it. So what the hell do you want from me?"

"I'm glad you asked," Wrang said with glee as he walked behind the operating table "Since you've been such a nuisance we figured we'd have fun with ya before we put you down" The krogan pulled out a thick green hose and wiggled it in front of the commanders confused face. He didn't have a chance to react before the hose was already in his mouth. As much as he resisted he could not stop them from digging the tubing deeper down his throat. There was no escaping his fate now. Whatever they had planned Shepard had to endure it until his squad could rescue him.

"Things are only going to get worse from here on out" Wrang joyfully said as he caressed the commander's cheeks.
112.title: Alien Captive

115.content:
Prothean Facility: Shepard discovers a Prothean artifact that causes him to gain weight.

Weight gain app: Shepard tries out a new app that allows the user to change and alter the weight of its user and the people around him.

Weight gain outbreak: The Normandy has been contaminated by an unknown alien virus which causes all the men to suddenly gain weight.
115.title: Other

choices: Something happens on route to Seiapod
1153.content:
“Attention Citadel council! This is an SOS from colony 2 on Seiapod! There’s some strange illness affecting all forms of life on the planet at the moment...well, male life. Women are somehow unaffected. We need immediate medical aid! Send only women, and hurry!” Valerie bit her lip as she sent the transmission. Normally the message would take days to reach the citadel due to how far away Seiapod was from other civilized life thankfully her father was able to give her some advice on to jury rig it to make the message get there faster. Although it was hard to hear his instruction clearly, what with all the weight on his face now. She sighed and shook her head. Help will get here. It has too.

Shepard gave the Normandy’s interior another look over. It has been a few years since the destruction of the Reapers and while the constant parading, press conferences, and taking the time to bask in the public’s praise was nice he needed some time to do what he wanted to do. And all he wanted was a boy’s night. Of course he wasn’t the only busy one after it all ended but he wanted nothing more than just a night or two out with his friends and shoot the shit and make some nice post war memories. So that’s what this week was for, all his fellow compadres that followed him to hell and back were going to join him on a galactic trip with no destination in mind besides away. They’ve already confirmed they were coming so at the moment Shepard, the ship’s AI EDI and his trusted pilot Joker were the only ones on board. Soon to be arriving were; Garrus, Wrex, Kaiden, Grunt, Thane, Zaeed, Mordin, Jacob, Javik, and James. He could hardly believe all twelve of them were able to get the chance to walk away for one whole week but he wasn’t going to let the opportunity pass by. In only a few shot hours the Normandy will be in space flight and the next few days will be full of nothing but hanging out with some of his greatest friends.
The merriment, while appreciated, didn’t last long. Within six hours of the Normandy taking off a distress signal was picked up by their communications array.
“...council....SOS...colony....Seiapod!...Illness...the planet...men...unaffected....immediate...aid...hurry!”
“Well, that’s not the worst static filled message we could’ve gotten at the start of our trip.” Joker’s voice filled the recreational area the others had settled in, an obvious attempt to keep things light.
“Innocent civilians need our help. Any objections?” Shepard asked. What met him were several faces of amusement.
“Honestly I wouldn’t count it as a vacation if there wasn’t at least one shoot out.” Garrus replied.
“I’ve needed this. I’ve been doing nothing but diplomacy for years! Do you know what that does to a Krogan?” Wrex replied, a smile, or at least as close to one as a Krogan could get, plastered on his face.
“Even with the Reapers gone there’s still going to be trouble. We’re still heroes after all.” Kaiden said standing firm.
Grunt was hollering nonsense but was obviously excited.
“Of course not.” Thane answered. “Hopefully I’m not too rusty.”
“Well damn, I’m already four deep. Guess I’ll have to slow down it we’re playing heroes.” Zaeed said, opening a fifth beer despite his statement.
“Assistance needed. Gender targeted illness? Intriguing. Need to study for myself.” Mordin stated.
“Count me in.” Jacob said. “We’ll be out of there and at a resort before we know it.”
“I’ll lend my assistance I suppose.” Javik dryly replied.
“The real question isn’t looking for objections, it’s wondering why you thought any of us would raise any.” James joked gesturing toward Shepard with his own bottle of beer.
“You heard ‘em Joker, let’s go. How far out is Seiapod? The message said they needed help urgently.” A friendly voice came to life.
“We should be able to get there in two hours and 13 minutes barring any flight accidents.” The ship’s AI, EDI, helpfully clarified.
“What she said. Well I would’ve only said two hours but you get the gist.” Joker chimed in himself. With that the skeleton crew was off.
1153.title: Viral Outbreak on Seiapod

choices: Follow Shepard, Garrus and Kaiden as they explore the outskirts of the colony
Follow Grunt, as he explores more of the colony
11531.content:
All twelve men stood at the front of the ship and watched as the planet came into view. Larger than earth but with more land than water Seiapod was a giant luscious paradise that humans could easily settle on as it’s atmosphere wasn’t terribly different. “Uhh hey guys? I’m getting a message stating that this planet is quarantined and that no one is allowed on or off the planet.” Joker said looking over his shoulder. He was met with eleven faces that clearly weren’t bothered by this development. “Oooookay but when zombies chase you back to the ship and you’re all banging on the door to get me to let you in I’m totally saying I told you so.” Joker chided. He then expertly guided the Normandy to the modest landing dock the planet had. The ground crew, which was everyone minus Joker, prepared to disembark. They all wore full body suits and respirators just in case.
“What’s a zombie?” Grunt asked.
“Living dead. Infect each other through biting. Can only be stopped with a shot through the head.” Zaeed replied.
“Awesome. Hope that’s what’s out there, I could use some target practice.”
“No guns. This is a simple recon mission first and foremost before we return to the Normandy and establish a base to help the men with the planet’s issues.” Shepard announced. A few grumbles were heard but the request was followed. A blue light washed over them as they were decontaminated, a few moments later the door opened to the outside, a nice breeze letting itself in. Before the group stood several women in simple clothes.
“Commander Shepard?!” A familiar voice cried from the head of the welcoming party.
“Yes, we’re here because of the dis-“ Shepard started to respond but was cut off.
“No you can’t be here! My message said it only infects men!” She cried out.
An awkward and tense moment passed before Shepard continued the conversation. “Who are you, and what do you mean? Your message was corrupted but it plainly said men were not affected by this illness.” Shepard said what the group was thinking.
“My name is Valerie, I’m the daughter of the leader of this colony. And quite frankly; no. It did not.” Valerie said coldly.
Shepard played back the message they received back to her, and the faces of all the women went ghastly white. “No...no! This is awful so many more men are going to be infected! We have to stop this! I’ll send ano-“ this time it was Valerie’s turn to be cut off.
“The planet was quarantined. No other crews are coming in...or out.” Javik informed. “So it’s either our gracious help, or nothing.”
After a moment of silence Valerie sighed. “Fine. But those masks and suits stay on alright?” Her demand was met by their nods.
Valerie led the group into the quaint colony, several women were seen running in and out of the sparse buildings but true to the welcoming party’s words there wasn’t a man to be found.
“I’m getting an awful feeling.” Jacob said. Kaiden, James and Wrex murmured their agreement.
“I was promised zombies.” Grunt huffed. Garrus let out a single laugh as they were led to a small building near the center of the colony.
“Ok I’m going to warn you...what you’re about to see isn’t for the faint of heart.” Valerie cautioned. After a deep breathe she opened the door and led the men inside. Within the home was a sight none of them would soon forget. A man with a gut the size of a queen sized mattress lay on his back, rolls of flesh oozed their way onto the floor, his appendages bloated to immense proportions, even his facial features seemed lost in his incredible bulk. Gasps, retches and surprise came from all the members of the group. It seemed all of the questions they had were clear even beneath all of their protective clothing because Valerie started explaining. “A few weeks ago a few of the men in the colony started to exhibit strange behaviors and curious symptoms. Our best researchers started trying to figure out what was wrong but by then the swelling had started. By the time the first victims had lost mobility all the other men were infected, we’re pretty sure the disease is airborne. We still aren’t sure why only the men were infected, our research has slowed since we lost the men of the research team. I’m not sure if you’ll even be of any help, but if there’s anything you can do I beg you to try. The...thing you see before you, I can scarcely call it a man anymore, is my father. And he’s one of the smallest men left in the colony.” Tears welled up in Valerie’s eyes.
“I’ll get started.” Mordin said after a small silence. His omnitool sprang to life as he rapidly typed on it and performed scan after scan. Several of the men walked out, needed a moment to themselves. Shepard, Garrus and Kaiden talked with Valerie some more.
Grunt stood fixated on the human in front of him. His pale skin was covered in bright red stripes, and his breathing was incredibly loud. The Krogan took a few steps toward the man before reaching out and pressing into his gut with his hand. It felt warm and soft with quite a lot of give to it. As he reached his other hand, a different hand quickly slapped the krogan’s hand off the victim’s body.
“Cease! Could get infected. Airborne is only a hypothesis, could be wrong. Be more careful.” Mordin quickly rambled off, despite talking to Grunt his eyes never left his Omnitool. Grunt muttered out a meek apology as he left the building.
Shorty thereafter Shepard’s party left as well leaving Mordin alone with the man turned blob of fat.
11531.title: Seiapod, the arrival.

choices: They all had gained weight overnight.
115312.content:
Grunt wandered the colony alone. He checked on a few more patients, pretending to have any sort of idea of what he was doing. He mainly just wanted to see more of the victims. Valerie wasn’t lying when she said her father was one of the smallest, Grunt met a couple victims who were so large makeshift shelters had to be set up outside because they grew too large for the confines of their houses. The whole thing was confusing to Grunt, he felt feverish or at least the base of his neck was incredibly warm. It felt like the area where his helmet and suit met was running up against his skin and the irritation it was causing was well...irritating. He walked several feet behind a house near the out skirts and looked around.
There’s no one here. He thought to himself I know they said it’s dangerous but my neck itches so much. If it’s airborne I should be fine as long as I hold my breath while my helmet is detached right? He hastily reasoned to himself. Before sense could return to him he took one more precautionary look around before inhaling deeply and then releasing the lock on his helmet, slightly lifting it up so he could slip his hand under his helmet and scratch his itch. He quickly redid the seal and then exhaled. His itch was gone, and he felt less feverish after that deep breath. Smiling to himself he figured it was time to get back to the Normandy.
After a short jog, Grunt found himself in the decontamination section of the ship. After a couple minutes the outside of his suit was completely disinfected, and the doors to the inside of the Normandy opened. He was surprised when he saw everyone else in the recreational area.
“....and that’s what I’ve found.” Mordin finished off a quickly spoken speech. Grunt blinked at the eyes that were now on him for interrupting. “Some of those guys are huge.” He said to the unentertained audience.
“Anyways, to refresh ourselves, and catch up the late comer, the disease thrives off testosterone which is why males are infected, a cure hasn’t even been started yet let alone created, and rapid creation of fat cells mostly happens when the victim is asleep. Did I get that?” Jacob asked.
“Precisely.” Mordin replied. “Lab will be set up tomorrow. Too late now. I’ll wake up early.” He prattled off as he headed towards the sleeping pods. Most of the others followed suit. Soon all that were left were Shepard, Wrex, Zaeed, Thane, Joker and Grunt.
“So it’s just making guys fat?” Joker said plainly.
“Yeah. Weird right?” Shepard responded. “We couldn’t find any plant or animal life that would even seem to cause that too.”
“Why don’t we just leave again? I have no desire to smother a bed with my ass.” Zaeed grunted.
“Quarantined remember? We technically shouldn’t be here. I don’t think you’d want to be in galactic prison either, or worse in galactic prison with a bed smothering ass. We could already be infected.” Thane mused.
“Impossible.” Wrex bellowed. “We had suits on, and respirators. Those things are state of the art, no way we’re infected.”
The conversation continued before the rest of the crew went to sleep. Little did they know the surprised that awaited them in the morning....
115312.title: The Itch

choices: Physical exhaustion, Hunger, Extreme and sudden spurts of growth
Mental exhaustion, Perspiration, Eructation, and Flatulence
1153121.content:
Slowly the sleeping pods opened, returning the twelve men to the waking world. They all had awoken around the same time and while usually this time would be spent discussing who would make coffee or get first go at the showers all eyes were on Grunt this morning.
Specifically his middle.
The Krogan stared wide eyed and slack jawed at the mass of flesh hanging off of him. He cautiously touched it and felt it slightly jiggle afterwards. “W-what.” Was all he could mutter.
Afterwards was a whirlwind of discussions and a hastily set up lab. Blood samples were taken from all 12 crew members and after several hours of test it was determined that each of them was intact infected with the virus, however so far it has only effected Grunt.
“I’ll get started on the cure. Not just for us.” Mordin said, quickly getting to work. Shepard and Garrus left to go ask Valerie if there was anything they should watch out for. The others quietly sat, trying to wrap their heads around their fate. Grunt excused himself and entered the restroom where he stripped off his pajamas and stared at his reflection. It looked bigger outside of the cloth shirt he was wearing. The basketball sized mound jutting off of him was still foreign to him, but having stripped to his briefs he realized that wasn’t the only change. His thighs were thicker, noticeably so. His hips have rounded out slightly, and his face looked slightly fuller or perhaps it was a trick of the light. He shook his head, put his clothes on again, even though a small sliver of stomach was always able to be seen, and walked back out to the others. Several minutes later Shepard and Garrus returned.
“Valerie told us about some side effects we should come to expect....”

133.title: An alien substance

choices: Joker's stomach starts expanding with the liquid
1331.content:
Joker stares at the vial for a moment, turning it up and down, watching the liquid flow back and forth. He coughed a bit, scratching the back of his neck as well. Damn, was he thirsty.

The pilot shrugged his shoulders as he opened up the vial. Shepard gave it to him to do what he wanted, and right now, the pilot wanted a drink. He pulled the top off, and then chugged the liquid down quickly. Unexpectedly, he let out a loud belch, but didn't seem to draw attention to it.

"Aaaaah, whew... Much better..."
1331.title: What harm could it do?

13313.content:
Joker went on with the rest of his business for the day, quickly forgetting about the vial entirely. He finished up for the day, allowing EDI to control the ship so he could get in some shut-eye. On his way to his quarters, he passed Shepard, who offered the pilot a quick smile.

"Joker, turning in for the night?"

"Yeah, if I'm not awake enough, I just might crash us into some planet. Of course, it's highly unlikely. Y'know, Jeff Moreau, hotshot pilot..."

"Right, right, right. What'd you do with that sample, by the way?"

"Sample...? Uuuh..." Joker scratched at his beard as he struggled to remember, "Oh... Actually, think I drank it. Got thirsty, didn't want to bother with the enormous hassle of walking away from the cockpit. Already takes me ages to get to my quarters with these legs."

Shepard seemed to smirk as Joker explained what he did, slowly nodding his head.

"Well, Joker, I'll see you in the morning. Hope you get a good sleep, big fella..." he said, walking off to do his own business.

Joker shrugged it off, and quickly headed off to bed.

The next morning, however, he was greeted by an unusual surprise. He woke up, and sat up in his bed to hear a loud sloshing sound from his gut, which then seemed to trigger a small belch from the pilot.

"Huh...?" Joker blinked, and then looked down at his stomach to see it had grown to...

choices: A fast food restaurant, just for a slight snack.
143.content:
"Alright Vakarian. You've fought mercs, cerberus, thresher maws, and reapers. Hard as it might be, you can do this too. Just take a deep breath, and... PULL!"
Garrus yanked hard on his pants, finally stretching them up past his large thighs. The waistband creaked in protest as it was forcibly expanded to fit his engorged stomach. Quickly but carefully, he grabbed the human garment he had picked up yesterday, something called suspenders, and attached them front and back.
The first time he did this, he fumbled with it horribly, and the straps and pants snapped apart, causing one of the buckles to whip up and whack him in the eye. That was earlier this morning, and fourteen tries and three split pairs of pants later, he was considerable more practiced. Of course all of this could have been avoided if he were on the citadel, or back on Palaven. Earth was notable lacking in plus-sized Turian outlets.
Huh. Funny, that was the first time Garrus had ever thought of himself as plus-sized. It was easy to forget, being here on earth, among humans. He had tried to ignore it for a while, but the fact was, he had put on a substantial amount of weight. Compared to the rest of the galaxy humans were fatty race. Getting fat was a normal part of their aging process, they were born covered in it, and they could get significantly larger than average without too much difficulty. Living on earth, Garrus had gained 30 lbs; by human standards, he had perhaps gotten a little chubby. Turians however were a much different kind of race. Their plate-like skin, their lightweight anatomy, and their military culture meant that fat was a rare thing on Palaven. By Turian standards, Garrus was morbidly obese.
He had certainly seen, or at least heard of, Turians bigger than himself, so he like to think that there was a store somewhere in the galaxy that sold clothes big enough for him. He supposed he could have had Shepard check on the citadel for him before she came back.... But that would involve telling her that he had blimped up while she was away.

Five months, it had only been five months. Just a quick tour of the galaxy again, a visit to everyone she hadn't seen in years. Tali on Rannoch; Wrex, Grunt, and Bakara on Tuchanka; they had, like she and Garrus, moved forward with their lives, and Shepard wanted to see it all, to remind herself that it was all worth it. Garrus had wanted to come too, but he had seen all of them recently himself, during a Turian fleet victory tour, and his new work on Earth, a desk job with planetary security, prevented him from joining Shepard this year.
Meanwhile, with no war to fight, the love of his life gone, and little to do but sit around, watch vids, and eat, that's exactly what Garrus had done. He didn't even need the new job, the entire crew of the Normandy was set up for life retirement after the war, but he found himself going stir-crazy without something to do.
Unfortunately, he had to balance that with his new, slower life with Shepard, so a desk job was the best option.
Of course, that hadn't done his burgeoning gut any favors.

The suspenders were his final option. His midsection was large enough now that they would be invisible under his shirt anyway. Spirits, they were tight though; the taut elastic was cutting into his shoulder, back, and belly. They had to, to be tight enough to hold the trousers at the right height.

Damn it, his body wasn't made for this. He pulled on an over-sized formal shirt, his only stroke of luck in this whole debacle. Turian formal wear was larger and roomier by design, even with that, it was a bit tight. Hopefully she wouldn't notice.

Time to get going to...
143.title: Settling down.

choices: Immediately commented on his weight gain.
1432.content:
Garrus got into his skycar and directed it to a McDonald's on the way to the spaceport. He still had a bit of time before Shepard's shuttle arrived, and he didn't want his stomach to be rumbling when he met her.
A number of restaurants on earth had started offering Turian/Quarian options since the war. A lot of fancy black-tie places claimed to have "authentic" Palaven fare. Garrus had tried them all, and he had not been impressed. Funnily enough, the only restaurant on all of Earth that got even close to right was McDonald's. Turian meals weren't sit down affairs. Everyone had somewhere to be, usually for some military purpose, so Turian food was nutrient dense and quick and easy to eat. The one way in which McDonald's differed was in quantity. The portions in a Small Palaven Medley were three to four times more than what the average Turian would eat in a meal.

Pulling up to the window, Garrus ordered a Large Medley with extra panem, and a soda. Soda was not something you could find on Palaven, but once the molecules were set right, it was delicious.

As the skycar made its way to the spaceport, Garrus inhaled the meal. He noticed as he did so that both his pants and his suspenders getting more and more painful. It was only after he finished the last bite of panem and washed it down with his last gulp of soda that he suddenly became concerned they might burst.
"Alright, just be careful when you hug her. Once you stand up it won't be so tight anyway. Suck it in." Garrus said to himself." The skycar landed at the port, and Garrus spent a few minutes emptying out the weeks of empty McDonald's wrappers and bags from the cabin to a nearby dumpster.

A few minutes later, he was standing at the gate watching Shepard's shuttle dock. His heart was pounding for more reasons then one. While he was terrified of her seeing him so large, he was also excited to have her back. Five months is a long time to be without someone. When she finally stepped off the vehicle, lovely as ever, she...
1432.title: A fast food restaurant, just for a slight snack.

14321.content:
"Garrus!",sheperd exclaimed,leaping into his arms.She gave him a loving kiss,alowing her tong to make its way into his mouth.Every previous thing he wanted to say to her was lost in that tender,yet cheesy,moment.

The parted lips due to the lack of air.Staring in eachother,garrus ran his hand through her cherry red hair,enjoying its vast softness.

They finally broke eye conact and sheperd patted garrus's big stomach."Looks like you gained a few pounds,my little turian?",she said.

Garrus blushed feeling her hand over his large bulg."A few",he said seepishly.

The made thier way to the skycar,hands intertwined.During the drive,sheperd started to recall her tales,amusing him.When they arrived at his apartment,it was already midday and garrus setted out to make lunch.

After the meal,wich garrus had the largest part of,they rested themselves outside on the balcony,overlooking the citadel.As garrus sat on the soft bench with sheperd wrapped around his arms,a thought went through his head.

"Sheperd?",he began.

"Yes?"

"I was wondering....."

"What is it,sweety?

He struggled to get the words out.Afraid of how she would act."I was wondering if we could start a family."The words where so sudden that it left sheperd speechless,but then she grinned.

"O,really.",she began,"Tell ya what:you gain some more weight and i'll think of getting pregnant,okay."

The turians mouth gapped,but the offer seemed pleasable."Okay,you have a deal then",he said.

She smiled and kissed him."Of course we do,my fatty turian."
14321.title: Jumped into Garrus's arms.

choices: Yeah, it is when you think about it.
14322.content:
"Garrus?" Shepard asked, with a slightly surprised tone. "Is that you?"
"Of course it is. Have you been seeing another Turian behind my back?" Garrus replied his usual sarcastic tone replaced with nervousness.
"Well I'm not use to seeing...so much Turian." Shepard replied with a small smile.
"Oh well you see..." Garrus started to rack his brain for an excuse.
"I like it." She replied, derailing his train of thought.
"You...errr...you do?" Garrus said dumbfounded. Where was this side of Shepard throughout their exploits, he wondered. He supposed that everyone had a fetish, he himself had a small fire burning for any red haired vixen who stood up for all the races on the citadel against an ancient machine race. And they were hard to come by, harder then say, an overweight Turian.
"Yeah. Strange isn't it?" Shepard answered as she blushed.
Garrus replied...
14322.title: Immediately commented on his weight gain.

choices: Shepard realizes she is bothered by the weight.
Shepard realizes she does like the weight.
143222.content:
Really strange, actually.

"...you're messing with me, aren't you?"
"Oh, so completely." She laughed, patting his gut. "Come on chubby, lets roll you home."
Garrus sighed, and fell in step behind her.
"It's not the end of the world, Garrus. Settling down, relaxing, putting on a few, it happens to everyone."
"Not to Turians it doesn't."
"I may not have a fetish for it, but it's not going to bother me. And if it worries you, just start eating less and hitting the gym more."
"I guess you're right. Maybe I'll even start tonight."
"Oh no, tonight, you're mine." She grabbed him, and pulled him close. The action caused one of his suspenders to snap and his pants began to sag on the right side.
Shepard laughed all the way back to the car, as he simmered in his embarrassment.

Once Garrus made it home, he and Shepard shared some "couple's activities," (which will not be described as per rule #2) but after...
143222.title: Yeah, it is when you think about it.

1432222.content:
Later that night, Garrus lay in bed, satisfied that his stamina had not been affected, at least.
Shepard lay beside him, her head on the soft rise of his stomach, listening to the rhythm of his breathing.
"Garrus?"
"Yeah?"
"About the weight..."
Garrus's confidence dropped like a rock, perhaps he hadn't been as successful as he thought.
"...y-yeah?"
"I think...maybe I do like it...a bit."
That wasn't the answer he was expecting.
"You do? For real this time?" There was a hint of bite in his voice.
"It's just...we spent so long fighting. There was so much cold and hard. It felt so nice to be with someone so soft and warm."
Garrus didn't know what to say.
"The gel underwear even felt better."
Garrus froze, the gel, he had completely forgotten it. A special undergarment designed for Turian-human interactions, it was marketed as the best way to prevent chafing. He wasn't sure his pair would even fit any more.
"I wasn't...wearing it." He announced.
Shepard sat up and looked at him for a moment, then quietly walked out the door.
"Oh Spirits..." Garrus thought. "I'm so fat I don't need the gel anymore, I've grossed her out."
He was certain she would be spending the night on the couch, and could only sit in bed, miserable, until, ten minutes later she walked back through the door, carrying several paper bags and a plastic jug.
"Shepard! I'm sorry, I'll start working out tomorrow, no more fast food. I won't even lose it all if you don't want, I'll just be as big as you want me to be."
"Is that so?" She asked coyly.
"Yes!"
"Well then, open up." She set the bags on the bed, straddled him, and pulled out a big box of panem.
"I...Shepard?"
"Garrus, tonight was the best you've ever been, and I think I know the secret to making you even better. If you're alright with it, that is."
Garrus took a moment to take it in, then opened his mouth. She placed a piece of panem inside, and he chewed happily.
"Turns out McDonald's does delivery now." She said, opening the jug of dextro mass gainer shake she had brought home with her, expecting Garrus to have withered rather than expanded as he lazed around for the past five months. She poured a huge amount down his throat, and he swallowed gratefully.
"You know, I could get used to settling down." He smirked.
"Eat up, big boy."
1432222.title: Shepard realizes she does like the weight.

14322222.content:
"Are you finished yet, honey?" Shepard called from the bedroom.
"(nggh) Almost! (crunch)" Garrus called back, his mouth still filled with food.
Shepard would have been irritated, if she wasn't so turned on. Knowing that every bite was more weight, that every second was that much closer to another pound of her favorite Turian, it gave her chills as she lay on the bed, waiting for their nightly ritual.
Suddenly, the familiar pounding footsteps began marching towards the bedroom, and she prepared her self for the show.

The door pushed open, and a very naked Garrus squeezed half-way into the room, the sides of his massive belly, thighs, butt, and moobs squished against the door frame.

Shepard laughed. "Oh my God, you're so gigantic!"
Garrus would have blushed if he could, and held his all-to-tiny hands over the gigantic mound of flesh in front of him. "Hey now, I worked hard on this, only because you asked me to."
He was still pretty insecure about his weight, even as he kept intentionally gaining more and more. It only got worse the heavier he got, but in honesty, that was part of the allure for both of them.
"What does the scale say, anyway?" He asked, the scale in under his feet being part of the ritual. The readout was on the wall next to him, as he hadn't seen his feet in five months.
"Just a hair over 682 pounds."
Garrus sighed. "You were right."
"More than twice as much as Wrex, big guy. No way he's making fun of you again."
"Are you kidding? Next time he sees me he might die laughing."
They looked it up a while ago, and found he had become the biggest and heaviest Turian to ever exist, with second place weighing in at 221 pounds. It was amazing how fast a Turian could get fat, when they really tried.
"Well, come on. Get in here."
Garrus shoved forward with all his might, the door creaking and groaning as his blubber pressed against it, but he found, no matter how hard he tried, the his bulk would not budge.
"Uh...we might have a problem here..."
Shepard laughed even louder, before she got up, shoved some more food in Garrus's embarrassed, but hungry maw, and yanked on him until he popped through the frame.
"We might have to think about moving, before you're too big to leave the house."
"I think that point might be only a few weeks away..."
"Lets make the most of this bed then." She said, shoving Garrus backwards onto the mattress. He landed with a thud, and his fat spilled over the edges like a waterfall.
14322222.title: Seven months later...

choices: She bring a very large snack for her love.
Garrun comes down the staires and starts to fondle with sheperd.
143222221.content:
It was the dead of night.All was asleep.sheperd rested her body on top of the turians massive gut with a blanket to cover her.Bellow her lied her love,snoring softly,being rewarded with a good night sleep before the dawn.
Thier was sudenly the sound of a load gurgeling noise that woke the sleeping sheperd.With eyes still heavy with sleep,she lifted her head up only to see garrus's eyes open aswell.
He gave a sheepish smile to her."Lookes like my belly wants a midnight snack",he said.
Sheperd smiled back at him."It does,doesn't it",she shed.
Slidibg off of garrun's gut she made her way to the kitchen.
143222221.title: Later that night...

choices: He's curious about how it feels.
152.content: How does the game's resident badass krogan gain weight?
152.title: Urdnot Wrex

1522.content:
When a transport ship, who was carrying good to the nearest citadel, fell ominously silent and completely stopped with its journey, Urdnot Wrex, a famed bounty hunter, was sent to investigate what happened to the crew.

The ship was eerily quite when the Kragon climbed out of his ship and entered the facility. There was no one aboard, but their was little sign that there was a fight or a hasty retreat from the ship.

To all was very strange to Urdnot. He was constantly on his guard, expecting something to pop out from one of the deserted rooms of the ship. But noting like that ever happened; the place was abandoned.

But, as the Krogan approached the area where the cafeteria, housing compounds and medical facilities were, he heard, smelled and felt very peculiar things: the first was the smell of cooked food from the mess-hall, the second was a crashing noise like glass falling coming from the medical-room, and the third a strong gust of wind coming from the hallway that had doors leading to the housing facilities.

The Krogan had to admit that he was a little startled. But he quickly regained his composure, deciding on what to investigate.

After some thinking, he decided to...
1522.title: Captured and force fed.

15222.content:
After thinking for a while, Urdnot finally decided that he should investigate the strange crashing noise that came from the medical-room.

He barged into the room, his plasma-blaster raised for action, expecting to find an enemy, but he was greeted by something completely different.

It was a robot. It was colored red and white with a health-cross stamped on its chest. The robot was dashing to and fro, hovering in the air, sorting out medicine and documents.

Urdnot let his guard down and stepping into the room, feeling a little foolish.

But the moment the Krogan did so, the machine suddenly stopped and turned towards Wrex, saying in a electronic voice: "O, a patient."

"No," said Urdnot, "I'm not sick. Do you know what happened to the-Owe!"

He wanted to asked what happened to the crew, but the robot, unexpectedly, stabbed the Krogan with a needle containing purple liquid, injecting the fluid into his neck.

Urdnot acted out of rage and instinct, firing his plasma-blaster at the machine. It fell towards the ground, lifeless, a sparking and smoking pile of bolts with holes in its chest where the blasts penetrated it.

Wrex growled in annoyance, plucking the needle from his neck and rubbing the small, swelling wound.

"Stupid machine!" he yelled, "No wonder everyone left this place!"

He exited the medical-room, thinking of just leaving and reporting that the ship was completely deserted.

But as he stomped off, he suddenly felt...
15222.title: investigate the medical-room.

choices: Urdnot eats and does not notice his expansion.
Urdnot manages to snap out of his trance.
152221.content:
As Urdnot Wrex stomped angrily down the hallway, he suddenly felt the gnawing feeling of hunger developing. It was strange, seeing that he ate only a few hours ago.

He would have ignored, but the smell drifting from the cafeteria was too mesmerizing to resist.

With his gut doing all the thinking, the Krogan headed for the mess-hall, lured in by the heavenly smell of food.

Like the rest of the ship it was deserted, but, like in the medical-room, dozens of robots were standing attention in the corner.

Urdnot ignored them and headed towards the Buffy that was laid spread out. He grabbed a few plates, filled them up with food of all sorts and sat down to devour his meal.

He ate and ate and ate! He consumed mountains of food, going for seconds, thirds and fourths, but he didn't feel the hunger sating.

Meanwhile, the Krogan's gut was beginning to balloon outwards into a beach ball sized sphere, straining his tight garments.

"This is *uuuurp* delicious!" he exclaimed, rubbing his bloated belly, "No wonder humans are so fat!"

He belched again and proceeded to gorge further.

While he was doing this, the machines in the corner suddenly came alive.

The filled up plates of food for the Krogan, bringing it to his table so that the he didn't have to do it.

And so it continued: Urdnot binged endlessly, only stopping to rub and admire his swelling belly. Tares were beginning to appear on his suit, and the seams were ripping open, not able to contain the Yoga ball sized belly anymore.
152221.title: Hungry (weight gain).

1523.content:
"You freaking fatass!" Wrex shouted for, approximately, the hundredth time today. He was currently on the human's home planet of Earth on business and couldn't help but notice how much wider some of the human civvies were, making the already small sidewalks even more cramped. He just didn't understand how someone could let that happen to themselves. What he understood even less was that the bigger ones seemed to be...happier. They had smiles on their faces, lovers on their arms, and an unhealthy snack in their hand. It wasn't just humans either, the ocassional overweight Assari or Drell walked by him seemed to be more content as well.
I must be missing out, he thought. Which stopped him dead in his tracks. Him, the great krogan who slew the Threser Maw, led the Urdnot clan, and saved the galaxy....wanted to be fat. He patted his abs and mentally decided where to eat lunch.
1523.title: He's curious about how it feels.

choices: He on medical leave due to an injury
He retired from the military and is enjoying civilian life
1543.title: more

155.content: A few more men to pick from.
155.title: more choices

info.brief_description: The men from the universe of Mass Effect are starting to gain weight.
info.description: Here are the rules, 1:No death, 2:No sex, 3:Male weight gain only NO female WG, 4:You use any method of weight gain you want, That is all.
